item.title: Digging for porcupine
item.summary: When the people go digging for porcupine they pluck off its quills at its hole and place them neatly ('nicely') together so that the wind will not disperse them.
item.comments: 1) p.7431v: see Rain's animals, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-16
item.author: |hanâ‰ kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
